author: parithosh
content:
While testing JWT auth on some CLs, my file mistakenly had a newline character added at the end. That caused the CLs to error out with `Invalid hex string: OddLength`. The fix was easy, to just strip the newline. But perhaps it would make sense for clients to strip EOL since I can imagine users running into this exact issue. 

Also perhaps we can add to the spec if the JWT hex file needs a `0x` or not? I think most clients allow for both, but it would be nice to have it specified.

author: g11tech
content: hope you didn't have it on lodestar, it strips the eols

author: marioevz
content: Similar issue was found for geth, and I think it will be commonplace if users do `echo 0x123... > jwt.f` for example, since it inserts the new line by default

author: tersec
content: pending a specification, I set Nimbus to start conservatively, because anything it accepts now has to be accepted in the future, but not vice-versa. But if there's a consensus, as it were, that this amounts a bug if it rejects the version with a newline, I'm fine having that be part of what's accepted
